name: Kujirai Momiji
desc: The founder of the Kujirai Guild and the elder sister of Kid Kujirai. As the successor to the Kujirai Fishing Method, she believes that their hereditary art will help the Kujirai Guild flourish and gain fame across Inazuma.

customize.name: Narukawa Ukai
customize.desc:
If you can stay within the Ideal Tension Zone while fishing, this rod will shorten the time in which fish will struggle by a stable amount and increase your chances of success. This effect only works in Inazuma.

A rod created to commemorate the ancient Ukai, or Cormorant, fishing method. The ruby-red gem at the tip of the rod represents the tinder used by the cormorant fishers, and the bird ornaments along the rod's shaft represent the cormorants themselves, who helped the hard-working Inazumans pass through those cataclysmic years. This low-efficiency fishing method has long become obsolete, but the persevering, pioneering spirit has been passed down together with this rod.

customize.name: "The Catch"
customize.desc: In the distant past, this was the beloved spear of a famed Inazuman bandit.

customize.name: Ako's Sake Vessel
customize.desc:
Specialized refinement material for "The Catch."
This was the favored liquor vessel of Ako Domeki, who once ruled over the Seirai region. The sea has brought it onto an angler's hook.

customize.name: Fishing Line Stabilizer
customize.desc:
A self-adaptive tension stabilizer that can be installed on a fishing rod to facilitate fishing. The device can automatically detect and record how hard different fish struggle. The more data it collects, the better the stabilizer works.

The device's prototype was the pointless invention of a Fontaine inventor that drew little interest for the longest time until the Fontaine Fishing Association discovered it and modified the product into the fishing line stabilizer used today. When the device first came out, it was most warmly received by the Association members, and now it has gradually been promoted in other regions.

It is an exceptionally hot commodity in the Snezhnayan market. Word has it that one of the Lord Harbingers is particularly fond of the product, which explains the hype.
